be thei war her, they should beware
the maidenes sone Marie, the Virgin Mary’s son
is highed fer enow, has grown far enough
to the bridil of horsis, up to horses’ bridles
kepe here othere, care for their people
cure of soulis, spiritual responsibility (ecclesiastical office)

div.head: Chapter 15
div.ab: [1] And I saugh anothere tokene in hevene gret and wondurful: sevene aungels that han the sevene wondis,G the sevene last in whiche the wraththe of God is endide. [2] And aftir I saugh a see cleer as glas mengidG with fier. And thei that hadden overcome that beste and his ymage and the noumbre of his name stonden upon the see cleer as glas, and hadden harpes of goldN [3] and sungen the song of Moises, Goddis servant, and sungen it to the Lomb and seiden, “Lord God almyghtful, thi werkes ben grete and wondurful. And Lord and kyng of alle the world, thi weies ben rightful and sothfast. [4] Who is it that ne shal drede thee and herienG thi name? For thou oneli art ful of pité, and therfor alle folk schulen come and onouren thee, for thi jugementis ben openli don.”

Bi the seven aungelis bitokeneth the sevene prechours of the bileve that schal dampneG hem that wolden not resseyve it. The see is clere as glass bitokeneth the baptym thereG the synnes ben waischen. In that it is mengid with fier bitokeneth the grace of the Holi Gost.N That thei hadden overcome the beste and his ymage and the noumbre of his name bitokeneth that thei that overcomen the temptaciouns of the world and of Anticrist and of the fend, thei schulen resseyve the innocence of baptym thorough sothefast penaunce that is bitokened bi the harpis, and for to kepe the Old Testament and the Newe, and that is the syngyng of the song that Moises song and of the Lomb that thei gladiden. That the werkis of oure Lord ben gret and wondurful bitokeneth that thei schulen understonde parfitliG of his makyng that ben wondurful. And that thei seiden that hise weies ben rightful and suthfast bitokeneth that thei schulen undirstonde that thei ben saved thorough sothfast bileve and thorough kepynge of his comaunde|mentis [fol. 223v] in right lyf. Bi that he seith that ther is noon that ne aughteG drede the Lord bitokeneth that thei ne dreden notG God, as on the oon half.G To beren hym reverence, it schal turneG to the halewenG into withouten ende in the love that thei have in hym.N That thei seiden he oneli is merciable bitokeneth that thei schulen felenG that oure Lord of his gret grace yeldith more meede in blisse and lesse peyne than a man hath deserved, and therfore alle folkis schulen honouren hym.

[5] And after I saugh the temple open in hevene. [6] And sevene aungelis wenten out that hadden the sevene woundesG and clad in a clene stoneG N and whit, and weren girden in girdelis of gold. [7] And oon of the foure bestis gaf to the sevene aungelis sevene violisG of gold ful of Goddis wrathtthe, lyvynge withouten ende. [8] And the temple is fulfillide ofG the smoke of the magesté of God and of his vertu, and noon may entre into his temple til the sevene woundis of the sevene aungelis been endide.G

The openyng of the temple bitokeneth the privetés of holi chirche that been schewed thourgh the prechoures that ben went out to alle londis. The clothing of the stoon clene and whit bitokneth the clannesse of herte and the vertu that thei han to suffren evel. The girdyng of the girdil of gold bitokeneth the wisdam of God that thei han, with whiche thei withdrawen hem fro evele willis, and it is clennesse in gost. That oon of the foure bestis gaf the violis to the sevene aungelis bitokeneth that the foure Gospelis been oonG and therfore he that wole not undirstonde the techyng that is open hemG T and taken ensaumple of holi mennes lyves, thei ben worthi to be dampned. That the temple is fulfildG of the smok and of the magestie of God and of his vertu bitokeneth that oure Lord and hise,G though alle that thei come to the jugement in brightnesse and in blisse to the goode, thei schulen seme to the othere derke and hidous.G That noon may entren into the temple til that the veniaunceG [fol. 224r] wer taken bitokeneth that the bodies of alle halewis schullen resten til the jugement, til that we rise fro deth to lyf with hem or in othere manere. Bi the smok is understonde that noon til that tyme shal witeG the privetés of the jugement thorough whichT he chesethG sum men to blisse and othere to dampnacioun.

div.note: noon that ne aughte, no one that should not
ne dreden not, do not fail to dread
it schal turne, their belief will become
to the halewen, for the saints

div.head: Chapter 16
div.ab: [1] And I herd a gret vois in hevene that seid to the sevene aungelis, “Goth and schedeG yee the sevene violis of the wraththe of God in erthe.” [2] And the first aungel wente out and schedde his viole into the erthe, and ther is maad gret woundeG N to men that han the mark of the best and to hem that honouren his ymage.
[3] And the tother aungele schede out his viol in the see and it bicam blood as it were of a deed man, and alle that hadden lyf in soule been deed in the see.

[4] And the thridde aungel schede his viole in the wellis and on the ryvers, and thei bicome blood. [5] And I herde the aungel of the water that seide, “Lord, rightful thou artT that hast geven these juges and jugid,T [6] that thei that schedden the bloodN of thin halewis, that thou geve hem blod to drynke as thei han disserved.” [7] AndT I herde another that confermede it and seide, “Ye,G Lord, rightful and sothfast ben thi jugementis.”

The grete vois of hevene that seide to the sevenn aungelis, “Goth and schedith the sevene violis of the wraththe of God” bitokeneth the commaundement that God schal comaunde his aungelis to take veniaunce of mysdoeris in erthe. Bi the felleG wonde that is maad to men that hadden the maark of the beeste ben bitokened the temptaciounsT of hem that for erthly thingis and delit of her flesch, for the love that thei hadden therto, thei wolden nothing be buxumG to Goddis comaundement but token hemG to Anticrist, and that is the marke of the best. That the viol of the secound aungele is schede in the seG and that it bicame to blod is bitokened thei of this world schullen be dampned that wraththedenG and tormenteden holi men in erthe and spilden her blod. Her peyne schal ben withouten ende. And that the wellis and ryveres bicame blod bitok|eneth [fol. 224v] that thei schulen be dampned that corumpen holi writ and han tourned the swetnesse of gosteli understondynge into filthe of fleschli wit.G Tho ben these eretikis and tho that prechen for worldli thingis and thei that tournen the Gospelis to pletenG with hym. Bi the aungel of the water is bitokened the holi halowen of hevenn that han joye of the rightwisnesse of oure Lord. That other that is aungil of wyndN bitokeneth the tribulacioun of gode men that herienG God and yelden hym graces whan that thei ben tormentid for holi chirche, for thei understonden that is for her goode.

[8] And the ferthe aungil schedde his viole in the sunne, and hym is gove leve to tormente men with hete and with fier. [9] And it hetith men of grete hete, and thei blasfemedenT the name of God that hath power and myght over these woundis, and thei han not do penaunce to yelden grace to God.

[10] And the fiftthe aungel schedde his viol on the ceteG of the beste, and his kyngdames ben maad derk, and thei eten her tungis for sorowe [11] and blasfemedenT God in hevene for her sorewis and her woundis, and thei diden not penaunce for her werkis.
[12] And the sexte aungele schede his viol in the greet flood of Eufraten, and the water bicam drie and maden redi the weyes of kyngis to the estward.G

The ferthe aungele that schedde his viole in the sunne bitokeneth the dampnacioun of Anticrist and of alle that thourgh his techingeN forsaken the right bileve and repenten hem not afterward and don penaunce. That the fifte aungele schede his viol on the seteT of the beste bitokeneth the dampnacioun of Anticristis disciplis that is bitokened bi his sete, for he regneth in hem. His regne is maad derk for the derknesse of mysbileve that thei ben in. That thei eten her tungis bitokeneth the envye that thei han to the holi, and therfore thei blasfemenT God when he schal chastisen hem thorough peyne at the laste, for thei come not to repentance. That the sexte aungel schedde his viol in the grete flod Eufraten bitokeneth the dampnacioun of tirauntis and of riche men of these that deliten hem her in worldli goodis but [fol. 225r] at the deth schulen resceyven povert for richesse, and whane thei ben put doun,G the weie of the right bileve is delivered to goode Cristen men and wymmen, and it is bitokened bi the kyngis of the est.T

[13] AndT I saugh out of the dragounnes mouth and out of the bestis mouth and out of the false profetise mouth foule spiritisT comen out as it were froschis.G [14] For thei ben spiritis doynge wondres, and thei schulen gon biforun to the kyngis of alle erthe to gedrenG hem to bataile to the grete day of God almyghtiN [15] that seith, “Lo, I come as a thef. Blessid be he that wakith and kepith his clothing that he go not nakid and that men see not his foulnesse.”N
[16] And thei schulen gedren hem togider to the stedeG that is clepid in EbruG Ermaledon.G

The mouthe of the dragoun bitokneth the entisement of the fende. The mouth of the beste bitokeneth the wordis of Anticrist. The mouthe of the false profetis bitokeneth the false prechinge of false eretikis.T Oute of thees thre comen thre foule gostis:G it ben pride, coveitise, and leccherie. These seemen froschisG for thei wonen in foule stedis, and thorough the crie of her false techynge, thei bynymen othereG her reste.N That thei doun wondresT and gedren kyngis togidre into bataile bitokeneth that right as the devel thorough Anticrist and his desiplis schulen make her conjourisonsG that schulen semen as if it weren miracles and schulen stereG the princes agen Cristene men. Right so it fareth in holi chirche that the fend thorough false prelatis in holi chirche and false clerkis doth wondres as of a child that cannot kepyn an appil.G N Thei maken hym kepereG of manye thousande soulis and corumpen the princes thorough evel ensaumple. The wakynge that oure Lord monestith us to bitokeneth right understondynge and good lyf that we be clepidG notT in wickid delices in ertheli thingis ne in delit of flesch. The clothing bitokeneth the vertu that man resceyveth at his cristnynge and afterward recovereth hym thorough verreyG penaunce. That he seith he cometh as a thef bitokeneth that he schal come sodenli to the jugement. The stede that is cleped in Ebrew Ermaledon bitokeneth this world and the fendis, for Anticrist and his profetis schulen do come togidre these kyng|is [fol. 225v] and these princes and setten hem in temptaciouns, and schal maken hem to risen agen God and holi chirche and ageyn the right bileve, and that is bitokned bi this word Ermaledoun, that is as miche to seie as “risynge temptatiouns.”N T

[17] And as the seventhe aungil schedde out his viole in the eyr, a gret vois came out of the temple and of the trone and seide, “It is doun.”T [18] And ther ben maad lightyngis and voisesG and thundris and stirryngs of erthe so gret that nevere yit was noon suche sithenG that man wonede in erthe. [19] And the gret cité that is departid on thre partiesG and the gret citees of men fellen. And God hath bithought hym on the grete Babilon to gyve to her the cuppe of the indignacioun of his wrethe. [20] And eche yleT fleighG and mounteynes weren not founden. [21] And gret hayl as a talentG cam doun fro the hevene into men, and men blasfemeden Gode for the plage of the hayl.T

That the seventhe aungel schedde his viol in the eirG bitokeneth the dampnacioun of feendis in the eir, there thei wonen for that thei ben of sotil science.G N The gret vois that came out of the temple bitokeneth the gret myght of Goddis word that he schal schewen at the jugement. That he seith, “Doon is” bitokeneth that the veniance of God schal be brought to the ende. The lightyngis and the voises and the thundris and the grete stiryng of the erthe bitoknen the grete tempestis of the jugement. That the grete citee is departid on thre parties bitokneth that the thre partis of the world schulen be dampned: the Jewis and the Saracenes and falseT Cristene men. And the peynesG weren divided after diverseté of synnes. The coppe of the indignacioun of the wraththe bitokeneth the mesure of peynes that God schal gyve to the synneres of the world that is bitokned bi Babilon, that he gyveth to ech as he hath disserved. That the iles fleddenT bitokeneth the goode Cristene men that ben beset al aboute with tribulaciouns in here lyf. As thei fledden heerG the kumpanye of synneres, so thei schulen fleen the peynes. That the mounteynes ben not founden bitokeneth that the holi men schulenT not be founden in the cumpanye of wickid. That the gret haile fel fro hevene into men bitokeneth the scharpe wordis and the hevyeG that oure Lord schal speke to hem that ben [fol. 226r] dampned. And men schulen blasfemenT God for the gret anguysch of the hail, for it is maad gret hastili, bitokeneth that the dampned in helle ben alto prowen ofG that oure Lord hath gret power to tormenten hem.

div.note: to the estward, from the east
bynymen othere, take away from others
kepyn an appil, keep an apple
departid on thre parties, divided into three parts
ben alto prowen of, have fully experienced

div.head: Chapter 17
div.ab: [1] And oon of the aungelis that hadden the sevene violis spak to me and seide, “Cum, and I schal schewen thee the dampnacioun of the grete bordelryeG T that sittith on many waters, [2] and there the kyngis of erthe han doun here leccherie.”T

[3] And he bare me in gostG into desert, and I saugh a woman sittynge on a reed bestG and ful of names of blasfemyeT and hadde sevene hedis and ten hornes. [4] And this womman was in purpreG and bordured aboute with goldT and of precious stones and gemmes and hadde in hir honde a coppe of gold ful of abhominaciouns and of filthe and leccherie, [5] and hadde writen in the forhede the name of hir, Mysterie Babilon, the gret moder of fornicaciounsT and of abhomynacions of erthe.

The grette see of leccherie and of abhominaciouns that the aungel schewide to Seynt JonT bitokeneth that oure goode Lord makith the goode prelatis to understonde the grete dampnacioun of Anticrist and his disciplis for her ydolatrie that is maumetrieG N and coveitise and leccherie. For bi the bordelrie that sittith on manye watris is bitokened Antichrist that regneth on myche folk. And the false prelatis that coveiten the grete richessis, that ben bitokned bi the watris and that thei wolen be worschiped in erthe more than fallith to hem. That the princes of erthe had don her leccherie with the bordelrie bitokneth that the lewideG taken ensaumple of Anticrist and of false profetisT and of false clerkis to lyven in delices of the wyn of that bordelrieT thorough whiche thei ben drunken.N That wonen in erthe bitokeneth the wisdam and the kunnyng that these coveitouse han to worldly thingis to fleschli delices. The woman that satte on the redde best bitokeneth Antichrist and hem that leden deliciouseG lyf in this world. The best that berith hym bitokeneth the fend that meynteyneieth hem. That she was clade in purple and ournedG with gold [fol. 226v] bitokneth that thei seme wise men to men of this world that knouen litil goode for the worschipe and richesse that thei han. The precious stones and jemmis bitokneth the vertu that thei han and her faire berynge and her goode werkis that thei putten forth withouten to the folk of the world. The coppe of gold that sche hath in hir hond bitokeneth holi write that thei turnenG and expounnen after her likyng. That the name of privetéT is writen in her forhede bitokeneth that oure Lord seith in the gospell of ypocritis, “Bi her frut yee schulen knowen hem,”N that is bi her wordes and bi here werkis, after that thei proficien in good. That he seithT Babilon the gret modir of fornicaciounsT of erthe bitokeneth that thorough the fend and vanytees of the world and wickidnesse of the wicked men cometh mysbileve and alle maner of synnes in erthe that drawen to confusioun.
[6] AndT I saugh the womman drunke of blode of holi men and wymmen of Jhesu Cristes martires, and gretli I wondre whane I hadde seen hire.

[7] And the aungil seid to me, “Whi wondrist thou? I schal seiG thee what the womman bitokeneth and the best that bereth hir that hath sevene hedis and ten hornes. [8] That best that thou hast seen was and is not and schal go out up of the deppeG T and schal go to distroccioun. And thei schulen woundre that wonen in erthe, whiche that the names ben not writen in the book of lyf fro the bigynnynge of the world.T

[9] “Here is to witte,G that the seveneT hedis ben sevene mounteynes on whiche the womman sit and ben sevene kyngis, [10] of whiche fyve ben fallen, and the sixte is and the seventhe is not yit, and whan he cometh, he mote dwele a litil tyme. [11] And the best that was and is not is the eighthe and ner the latere oon ofG the sevene.

[12] “And the ten hornesse that thou seie ben ten kyngis that han not yit resseyved her kyngdames but thei schulen resceyven, after the best, power as kyng is oon our.G T [13] Thei han oG counseil and o vertu, and her power thei schulen gyve to the beste. [14] Thei schulen fighte with the Lomb, and the Lomb schal overcomen hem, for he is Lord of lordis and Kyng of kyngis. And thei that ben with hym ben clepid and chosen trew.”

[15] And [fol. 227r] the aungele seide to me, “The watris that thou hast seien wher the bordelrie sittith been dyverse folkis. [16] And the ten hornes that thou seie in the beesteT shulen haten the bordelrye of the womman and schulen maken hir discoumfortid and nakid and schulen eten hir flesh and brenne hir in fier. [17] God hath set in her hertis that thei doon her willeT and that thei gyveT her kyngdam to the beste til Goddis word be endide. [18] And the womman that thou seie is the grete citee that hath power of the kyngis of erthe.”T

The womman that was drunken of the blod bitokeneth the grete veniaunce that God shal take of tyrauntis that schedden the blood of good Cristen men, outher it bitokneth the grete veniaunce that oure Lord schal taken of the grete lecherie and of the grete bobaunceG that these false clerkis maken. The wondryng that Seynt Joon made bitokeneth the grete compassioun of goode men of holy chirche that schulen seen tho synful men stiyen up in synne to her owne dampnacioun. Al holi writ, that is bitokned bi the aungil that techeth hem that it is rightwisnesse of God and for her synnes that thei han discerved, that thei be maad more bi understondyng.T That the beeste was and is not and schal come out up of the depnesse bitokeneth that thorugh the comynge of oure saveoure was the myght of the devel in erthe abatid, and schal comen anothere tyme in Anticristis tyme. “But oure Lord schal distrueG hym thorough the vertu of the spirit of his mouth,” IsayeG seith.N That thei that wonen in erthe ben wondrid of hir bitokeneth hem that folowen hym schul be gove alle to erthli thingis and to delite of flesh. The sevenn mountisT on which the beeste sat bitokeneth the sevene dedli synnes thorough which the develle makith men to prudenG and risen ageyne here creature.G The sevenn kyngis thorough which the devel governeth alle hise and ledith hem into helle ben the fyve wittisG of man, and the sext is yvel wil. The sevenethe that is not yit is Anticrist, and he is the eightithe that passith alle othere in synnes and in peyne,G and he is oon of the sevene for the felawschip that he berith to synne and in sorowing of peyne. And these ben the kyngis that undirlyngisG been to Anticrist and bitokeneth the grete lordyngis of this world that thorough envye werenG agenn Goddis comaundement. Alle thei han oon counseil, that is the counseil of the world, to taken with right and with wrong of her undirlyngis and of here neghhebores. Her vertu and her power [fol. 227v] thei schulen delyveren to the beeste, for alle here age and al here with thei han dispendidG in the develis service. And as the kyngis schulen and AnticristT fighten agenne the Lomb and his membris to bynymenG hem the right bileve that thei han in Jhesu Crist, right as thei that werren now holi chirche and not oonli in bodili thingis but in goostli also. For thorough the taliageG that thei maken, thei bryngen the symple folk into synne. But the Lomb schal overcome hem at the jugement, for alle the jugementis ben goven to Goddis Sone, and his jugementis ben trewe. That the watris that the womman sat on been many manere of folkT bitokeneth that the moost part of the folk schulen folowen Anticrist and his disciplis that now geven hem to fleschli likyng. The tene hornesse schulen hate the bordelrye, that bitokenen hem that been dampned that thei schulen haten hem and repreven hem thorough whiche thei comen thider, as Isaye seith.N That thei schulen etten fleisch bitokeneth that thei schulen deliten hem in torment of hem thorough which thei ben dampned. That he seith that the bordelrie schal be discoumfortid and nakid bitokeneth that thei schulen understonde that her peynes schulen han noon ende, ne no werk that thei deden here that hem thoughte goode schal never helpen hem. That he seith that God hath sette in here hertis to doon that hem likith bitokeneth that summeT han here wille and that thei ben underlyngis to the fend for her synnes to be his disciplis in erthe til that holi writ be fulfillid. The grete cité that is bitokenede bi the womman bitokeneth the grete multitude of wickide men of the world, and that he hath power on erthli kyngis and not on goostli kyngis.T

div.note: ner the latere oon of, nevertheless one of
is oon our, for one hour

div.head: Chapter 18
div.ab: [1] And after I saugh an aungele comynge doun fro hevene that hath grete powere and lightede the erthe with his glorie. [2] And he criede strongli, “Fallen, fallen is Babilon the grete, and it is made the wonnynge stedeG of develis and it kepith al foule spiritis and eche foule brid.G [3] For that alle folk han drunken of the wyn of leccherie,T the marchaundisG of erthe beenT maad riche of hir delices.G”

Bi the myghtful angil that cam doun fro hevene that seide, “Fallen is Babilon the grete” bitokeneth Goddis Sone that came here into the erthe and lightede holy chirche thorough his techynge that he taughte bothe with word and werkis. The dampnacioun of hem that geven hemG to the world in bodi and in soule for thre synnes that thei han in hem. Coveitise is bitokened the wonnyng [fol. 228r] stede of the devele, and leccherie is bitokened bi the kepyng of wickid spiritis, and bi the foule briddis ben bitokenede pride. Bi the marchaundis is bitokened hem that lyven in these thre synnes and corumpen othere thorough evel ensaumple. And bi the wyne of fornicacioun is bitokened fleischli wisdam that is for wynnynge,G and that is coveitise.T And bi the fornicacioun of kyngis is bitokenede leccherie,N bi the vertu of delices ambicioun, and that bitokenethT pride.

[4] And I herde anothere vois that seide, “Go yee out of Babilon, my folk, and be ye not partener of hir dilycesG N that ye take not of hir woundis.G [5] For hir synnes been stiyed upG to hevene, and the Lord hath recordidT of hir synne. [6] Yeldith to hir as sche yeld to hem,T and double hir doubleT after hir werkis. The drynk that sche medledeG T to you, mengithG hir double. [7] The more that sche glorifiede hirG and was in delices, as myche gove yee hir tormentis and wepyngis. For that sche seith in hir herte, ‘I sitte as a quene, and I am not widewe, and I schal never more see thing that I schal been yvele at eseG thorugh.’ [8] Therfore schullen hir woundis come fro God on oG day, deth and wepyng and hungir, and in fier sche schal be broyled, for strong is God that schal jugen hem.

[9] “And there schulen wepen and pleynenG on hir the kyngis of erthe that with hir han doun fornicaciounT and han lyved in here delices, whan thei schulen seen the smoke of hire brennyng, [10] and thei schulen stonde aferG for drede of hir tormentis and schul sein, ‘Wo, wo, this grete cité Babilon, this grete stronge citee, that in oon our is comen jugement and it is distroyyed.’”

That the vois monestideG Goddis folk to wendeneG out of Babilone bitokeneth that holi wryt techith usT and monestith us that wee schulen not conforme oure lyf nether oure werkis to the multitude of the world. That men seyn that meG schal doublen hym up his werkis bitokeneth hem that tormenten Jhesu Cristis frendis in bodi and doun hem torment. Thei schulen gyven hem to torment in bodi and in soule, and for the peyne that thei diden hem in an oure,G thei schal go to peyne that evere schal last. That the vois seide that as myche he gloriede hym and was in delices, as myche gif hym torment and peyne, that bitokeneth that after the diversité of synnes and after the mychilnesseG of synnes schal ben [fol. 228v] the gretnesse of peynes and of torment. That he seith he sat as a queneN bitokeneth that the synneres of the world gloryenG hem in heighnesse.G That he seith, “I am not widowe”T bitokeneth that he gloriez hym in delit of flesh. That sche seith, “I schal nevere see thing that schal do me harme” bitokeneth that sche glorieth hir in richesse, and therfore at the day of jugement or at the day of deith, thei schul be lowid, that is bitokenede bi the wepynge.T And hem schal come defauteG of alle goodis, that is bitokened bi the hungir.T These thre thingis schulen be dampned han withouten endeT ageyne these thre thingis that thei glorien in this world: heighnesse, pride, and fleshli delit, and plenté of erthli goodis, that thei schulen han the depnesse of helle and anguysh of torment and defaut of goodis, and with alle these the fier of helle schal brennen hem, for the brennynge wil in evel,G N and thatT schal lasten withouten ende. For the juge is stronge and may not flecchenG for preyere ne fore gifte ne for noon othere thing, as it is writen in the book that Salomon maad.N That the kyngis of the erthe pleynen hem of the distruccion of Babilon bitokeneth the sorowes that grete lordis han whane thei schulen departen out of this world, for the richessis and delit that thei schulen leten.G The smoke of the grete brennynge is the grete siknesse that ben messageris of Deith and of the fier whidir thei schulen goon. That thei stonden fereG for drede of the tormentis bitokeneth the orrourG T and drede that thei han of the deth for the peynes that abidenG hem. That thei seyn, “Wo, wo, the cité that was so grete and strong” bitokeneth the grette pleynteG that thei schulen leesen,G T and here erthli power and here synnes thei schulen pleynen littil or nought.
[11] “And the selleris of erthe schul wepe on hir and make dool,G for ther is no man to bienG her marchaundise, [12] gold no selver ne preciouse stones, margaritis,G bis,G purpre.G T

[15] “And alle othere marchaundiseG schulen stond ferG fro hir fore drede of the torment and schulen wepen [16] and seyn, ‘Allas, allas, this grete cité that was frettidG with bis, purpre, gold, and silvere and jemmes,T [17] and so many richessis, thei ben distroiyed in an oure.’

“And ech governoureG and alle that rowen in swete waterG and maryneres and thei that werkenT in the see schulen [fol. 229r] stonden aferre [18] whan thei seen the stede of the brennynge and seiden,T ‘Suche a citee was nevere,’T [19] and leiden powderG on her hedis and schulen wepen and crie and seyne, ‘Allas, allas, this grete cité in whiche alle been maad riche, that hadden schippis in the se, that in oon our is distruyed.’ [20] Joieth upon hym, yee hevenes and apostlis and profetis, for God hath demedG youre domeG of hir.”T

The marchaundis and the selleresT and eretikis and ipocritis that thorough veynglorie of the world don here goode dedis, these marchaundis and the biggersG bitokeneth symonyes.N T Thei han grete sorowen and drede whane the deth cometh and pleynenG hem and waymentenG for the false goodisG that thei schulen forgoon for the grete harmes that thei schulen resceyven at the jugement. The governouris and the maryners bitokenen the prelatis of holi chirche, litil and mychil, that loven richesse of this world. That thei leyden poudre on her hedis bitokeneth that thei leyden erthli richessis on here hertis and in here thoughtis, either it bitokeneth late repentance. That the aungil bad the apostlis and the profetis and the holy maken joyeT of the distruccioun bitokeneth that the hooly halowen consenten to God at the jugement at the dampnacioun of the wickid that ben schent,G and holi chirche yeldith grace to God whane he sendith tribulacioun to chastisen synneris of erthe.

[21] And a strong aungil lifte up a greet stoon as it were a grete mylne stoonG and caste it into the see, and seide, “With so grete a fruschG schal be cast in it the grete cité Babiloun. And schal never more be founden in it [22] vois of harperie, of pipe,T neither of trumpe, ne schal nevere more ben herde in hir ne founden the vois of mynstralsie.G T [23] And the light of the lanterne schal no more lighten hir.T And vois of the spouseG and of the spousesseG schal nevere ben herde in it. For hir marchaundis weren princes of erthe and for that in hir venym doyngisG alle folkis han errid.T [24] And the blod of profetis and of holy men is founden in it.”T

That the aungile caste the stone into the see bitokeneth that Jhesu Crist schal casten into helle hem that hadden the herte hardeG in coveitise and robbedenG al aboute to wynne erthli thingis and schulen be tormentide withouten ende for diverse richessis that thei hadden. The vois of harpe bitokeneth the delit of this world that hath diverse tor|mentis.T [fol. 229v] Bi the harpeT and bi the menstralcies been bitokened sotile engynesG and curioustésG to wynnen.G Bi the vois of the hurlyng of the mylne stoneG is bitokened deliciouse metisG and drynkis.N Bi the light of the lanterne is bitokened bobanceG and faire servyse in house. Bi the vois of spouse and of spousesse is bitokened the delit of fleisch. That the marchaundis weren princes bitokeneth that the grete lordis of the world taken with strengthe therG thei schulden not taken but fore here servyse as knyghtisT to kepe the pees and defend the prechoures and the prelatis to techen Goddis folk, outher it bitokeneth hem that aughten to techen and governen and kepen the othere, ben quenchidG bi preysyng and lordschipe.N T Bi the errour of hir venymT is bitokened that the oon is corumped bi the othere thorough evel exsaumple. That the blood of the profetis and hooli men is founden in it bitokeneth the cruelté of grete lordis of this world that thei han don to Goddis halewen.

div.note: vois of the hurlyng of the mylne stone, sound of the grinding millstone

div.head: Chapter 19
div.ab: [1] After that, I herde a grete vois as it were a grete multitude of folk that seiden in heven, “HeriyngeG and glorie and vertu be to oure God. [2] For his jugementis been sotheG and rightful that hath maad right of his grete bordelrieG that corumpide the erthe with hir grete bordelrieT and hath vengide the blod of his hooli halowen.” [3] And often thei seiden, “Alleluia!T And the smok of hym steigh up withouten end.”
[4] And the foure and twenti grete and the foure bestis fellen doun biforne the trone and honoureden God and seyden, “Amen, Alleluia!”
[5] And a vois came out of the trone and seide, “Gyveth heriynge to oure God, all his halewen, and that ye dreden hym litil and michil.”

The vois that Seynt Joon herde in hevene bitokeneth the grete joye in holy chirche in hevene and in erthe, and yelden heriynge to God for the victorie that Jhesu Crist hath had overe the feend for his deth and for his blisse of his resurectioun, and for the vertu of his jugement that is myghtful and rightful. The vois that came out of the trone bitokeneth the vois of the Gospelis that monestith us that in sothfast bileve and right liyf, we yelde heriyng to God for the grete goodnesse that he hath doun us in this lyf and schal in the tother.

[6] And I herde a voisG as it were a grete troupeG T and as it were of many watris [fol. 230r] and a voise of many greet thundris of hem that seiden, “Alleluia!T Fore oure Lord God almyghti schal regne. [7] And make we joye and blisse and gyve we heriynge to hym for the weddyngis of the LombT been comen. And his wyf hath dressid hir, [8] and it is gove to hir that sche clothe hir with bisseG cleneT and whit, that is the justifiyngisT of holi halewen.”
[9] And he seide to me,T “Blessid ben thei that been clepidG T to the soperG of the bridalesG of the Lomb. These been the sothfast wordis of God.”
[10] And I fel to the aungelis feetT to honouren hym. And he seide to me, “Lok thou do not! I am Goddis servant as thou,T and thi britheren that beren witnesse of Jhesu. Worschip thou God.”T

And as the joye was aforn ofG the overcomynge of the fend, so this joye is of helth in holi chirche, of the blisse that thei han that ben savede. And the grete that ben bitokened bi the thundris, and the litle that ben bitokened by many watris.N The spouse of the Lomb bitokeneth holi chirche, and that Jhesu Cristis spouse tiffedeG hir bitokeneth baptem and schrift.G Clere and whit bitokeneth the vertu that sche is ournedG T with. The souper of the Lomb bitokeneth the joye of paradise. That he seith thei ben blessid that been clepid bitokeneth that thei ben clepid that been maad worthi in this lyf, tho ben that stedfastli beleven and wele lyvenT and worthili resceyven the sacrament of the auter.G N That Seynt Joon fel to the aungelis feet bitokeneth the meknesse and obedience of holi chirche. That the aungele defendide that he dide no more so bitokeneth that man schal ben bi the aungil in blisse and with the aungil worschipen God and herien hym withouten ende, and he schal be blessid.

[11] And I saugh hevene open, and thoG I saw a whit hors, and he that satt theroon, his name was Trewthe and Sothfast. And he jugith and fitithG agene the unrightful. [12] And his iyeenG been as flawme of fier and on his hede many corownes, and hath a name writtyn that noman knowith but hymself. [13] And he is clothid in a robe redidG with blod, and is clepid Goddis Sone.T [14] And the osteG of hevene folowide hym on white horsT andT been clad in the lynnen cloth of hym whit and clene. [15] And out at his mouth came a swerd kervynge to distruen the misbilevynge, and he schal governe the folk in an yren yard.G And he tredith the pressoureG of the wyne of Goddis wraththeT [16] and hath writen on his robe and on his hipe:G T “Kyng of Kyngis and Lord of Lordis.”

[fol. 230v] The white hors bitokeneth Jhesu Cristis fleisch clene of synne that wonnethG with the godhede. His iyen bitoknen the grace of the Holy Goost. That he semede as flamme of fier bitokeneth that he lighteth men to lyvenG T aright and hotithG hem to do good werkis. That he had on his hede many corounes bitokeneth that bi vertu of his godhede he hath power to corounen his chosen after that thei han discerved. The clothing redid with blod bitokeneth the holi martires that schedden her blod for his love in erthe here. The oost that is in hevene that folewed hym on white hors and the whit clothing bitokeneth hem that wolen fighten ageyn the fend thorough lownesse and bi quentise,G ageyn the world bi pacience in advercité, bi prudence in prosperité, ageyn the fleisch bi discressioun and abstinence and austeritéG of penaunce and in clene clothis of vertues and of good werkis.T That out at his mouth cam a swerd kervynge on boith parties bitokeneth hem that resseyven not the prechynge of the right bileeve schulen be dampned in bodi and soule. That he hath defoulid the pressoure of the wyn of Goddis wraththe bitokeneth that hymself suffrede the anguysh of deth on the rodeG to bienG man fro deth to lyf that evere schal lasten and maken hem clene of synne and delyveren hem fro peyne. That he hath writen in his robe and on his hipe “Kyng of Kyngis and Lord of Lordis” bitokeneth that he schewith in his manhed that he was and is almyghti, outher it bitokeneth the goode children of holi chirche that been as robes that ben clade with right bileveT stedfastli that he is bothe God and man.

[17] And I saugh an aungil stondynge in the sunne and criede with grete vois and seide to alle the foulesG T that fleen thorough hevene, “Cometh and gedere togidere to the grete soper of God [18] to ete the fleisch of kyngisT and the fleisch of the hors and of hem that sitten on hem and fleisch of the free and of thral,G and of litil and of mykil.”N

[19] And I sawgh the beest and the kyngis of erthe and here oost to do bataile agen hym that sat on the white hors and with his oost. [20] And the beest is takyn and the false profetis with hym and he that dide the wondrisN thorough which he betrayede hem that resseyveden the marke of the beeste and honoureden his ymage. These two ben cast into the pit with fier and brennynge brunston.G [21] And the other ben slayn with swerde that camen out of the mouth of hym that sat on the hors, and alle foulis been fulfillidG of here fleisch.

[fol. 231r] Bi the aungele stondynge in the sunne ben bitokened the prechours that wele worchen in the bileve of Jhesu Crist. Bi the fowlis is bitokened the halewis that setten here hertis to thyngis that is above. The soper of God to the which thei been somoned bitokeneth the blisse of hevene. The etynge of the fleisch of the oon and of the other bitokeneth the grete delite that the hooli men and wymmen schulen have at the grete jugement of the tourmentis that dampned men shulen have.N The beest bitokeneth Anticrist, the kyngis of the erthe his apostlis. The batayle bitokeneth the persecucioun that he schal doun to Cristen folk, but Jhesu Crist shal distruyen hym thurgh his word. As YsayG seith, “He shal sleen the wickid thurgh the spirit of his lippis,”N and shal caste hym and his disciplis into the brennynge fyer of helle, and in the stynk that is bitokened by the brunstoun, and the othere that bileven in hym that shulen be dampned. But thei shulen not be in so grete peyne, and of this distruccioun shal holi chirche have grete joye in hevene and in erthe,N and that bitokeneth that alle the fowlis in hevene ben fulfillid of her fleisch.

div.head: Chapter 20
div.ab: [1] AndT I saugh an aungele comynge dowun fro heven and hade the keye of the pitte of depnesseG T and a grete chayne in his hoond. [2] And he tok the dragoun, the olde serpent that is clepid the feend and Sathanas, and bond hym for a thousand yer [3] and caste hym into the pitte, and bischytteG hym and sete a seel on hym, that he schuld not disseyve the folc til a thousand yeer weren goon. And after that, he mot be unboundoun a litil tyme.

[4] And I saugh the segis and that seete on hem, and the jugement is govun to hem. And I saugh the soules that her heedis weren smyten off for that thei beren witnesse of Jhesu Crist and for Goddis word. And thei that han not honouride the beeste ne his ymage ne resseyveden his marke in her right hond ne in here forhede shulen lyve and regne a thousand yeere. [5] The othere that ben dede schulen not lyven til a thousand yeere ben goon, and that is the first risyng agen.G [6] Blissid be he that hath part of the first rysyng agen.T He schal not be hurt of the secounde deith, but thei schulen be Jhesu Cristis prestis and shulen regne with hym a thousand yeere.

The aungele that cam doun fro hevene bitokeneth Jhesu Crist. That he had the key of the pit bitokeneth that he openede the prisoun of helle to delyveren hise, and that he openeth yutG ech day the synnful mannes herte that [fol. 231v] is derk thorough synne and makith hym light thorough his grace to resseyven hym. The grete cheyne in his hond bitokeneth the gret myght of his Passioun and of his Resureccioun. That he bond the devele a thousande yere bitokeneth that he bynamG hym his power til the commyng of Anticrist. The seel that he sette on hym bitokeneth the cros with which Cristen men defenden hem fro temptaciouns. The putG he caste hym in bitokeneth the peyne that he hade that he myght not disceyve the folk as he dede biforhonde. After the thousand yeere been goon, Anticristis profetis schul regne and comen more and more and corumpen Goddis lawe and tourne it after her lyvynge. For than schal the feendis power rise more and more in holi chirche. His profetis been coveitouse men of holi chirche, proude men and losengeris,G men lecchoures. But the losengeris ben worst of alle that maken hem holi outher for drede outher fore love, outher for ler.G T That thei hopenG thei schulden nothing han of hem yif thei seiden hem the sothe.G N These han taken undirhondG to speke the develis langage to disceyven Goddis children and binyme God his eritage, and which ben strenger and werse than any devel in helle. Therfor ech man that wole plese GodT kepe hym fro suche, be it man, be it womman, or thei schulen go with hem to her lord, that is the fend of helle.N That he saugh sitteris on her segis bitokeneth that as long as Sathanas is bounden, holi chirche regneth and is free to serve God and obedient to the prelatis. And thei wenten out of this lyf thorough sothfast schriftT and repentance and sorewe for her synnes, her soules schulen regne with Jhesu Crist. And thei that dien in deedli syne, her soulis goon to peyne. The frist resureccioun is of the soule that riseth out fro dedeli syne thorough the grace of God. Thorough schrifte and sorewe of herte and penaunce doyng risith to lyf of grace, and this is the secounde resureccioun that thei han part in. That is to seie thei schulen risen at the jugement in bodi and soule into lyf of blisse. And that is the blessyng that thei schulen han, for thei schulen be glorifiede in lyf and eckeG in soule and herienG God withouten ende. That is that he seith thei schulen been Goddis prestis and Jhesu Cristis and schulen regne with hym a thousand yeere, that is withouten ende.

[7] Whane a thousand yeere ben passid, than schal Sathan been unbounden and schal goun out of his prisoun and schal bitrayen the folk on foure halfG the world. Gog [fol. 232r] and Magog he schal semblenG in batale. The noumbre schal be as the gravel of the see.N [8] And thei schulen sitte on the heyghest of erthe,T and thei schulen be setten alle aboute holi mennes houses and the citee that God loveth. [9] And fier schal come doun fro hevene and devouren hem. And the devele that bitrayed hem schal be sent into the pond of fier and of brunstoun with the besteG [10] and with the false profetis, and schul ben tormentid nyght and day withouten ende.

The prisoun that the feendT cam out of to bitrayyen the folk bitokeneth the hertes of synneres. There he was afornhondG beschutG in that he might not noyyenG as myche as he wolde. And that bitokeneth the name of tweie manere folk, Gog and Magog. For Gog is mychel to seie asG thing that is hid and Magog as thing that is unhid. Bi these tweie maner folk that he bitrayyed preveli, that bitokeneth Anticristis disciplis. Bi Gog is bitoknede hem that hiden here synnes, as these eretikis and ypocritis. And by Magog ben bitokned the fals prophetesT that afterwardis schulen prechen openli, and the tirauntis that schulen sleen hem that wolen not forsaken the beleve of Jhesu Crist. That thei schulen wenden overale the erthe bitokeneth that he schal senden his disciplis overal to prechen, that thei schulen setten her power ageyn the bileve of holi chirche as bi prechynge and miraclis, bi manasG and torment. That is that he seith thei schulen envyrowenG the houses and the cité that God loveth.T The fier that cometh doun fro hevene bitokeneth apertG veniaunce that God schal take of hem that wolen not amenden hem.T

[11] And I saugh a grete trone alle whit and he that satte theron. Fro his sighte flede hevene and erthe and ne founden no stedeG where thei myghten reste.T [12] And I saugh the dede and the qwykG N stonden bifore the trone. And a book is open, and another book is open that is of lyf. And the deede been jugidT of hem that been writen in the book of lyf after her werkis. [13] And the see gaf the dede that werrenT in hym. And Deth and helle han yoldenG her deed menT that thai hadden. And ech ben jugid after her werkis in helle. [14] And theiG been sentT into the pond of fier that is the secounde deth.T [15] And he that is not founden in the book of lyf writen, he is sent into the pond of fier.

The grete trone that is whit is bitokened holi chirche that Jhesu Crist restith hym in at the jugement. That the erthe and hevene schulen fleen bitokeneth the drede [fol. 232v] that the coveitouse menT and the lecchoures schulen han. That the bookis been opened bitokeneth that the goode conscience schulen been opened apertliG to alle folk how thei han kept the comaundementis of God. That the book of lyf is opened bitokeneth that Jhesu Crist schewith hym in myght of his godhede, and the dede schulen been jugid after that Jhesu Crist suffrede in his manhede and after the gospele and after the understondyng of her werkis. The seG castith the deede that weren in hym bitokeneth that the men of the world schulen come out to ben jugid that thei gyven al here herte to temporalT thingis. That Deth and helle han yolden her deed and schulen be sent to the peyne of helle bitokne that twey maner of folk schulen be dampned in bodi and soule, nameli thei that dien in mysbileve andT he that dieth in deedly synne. That he that is not founden in the book of lyf writen schal be sent into the pond of fier bitokeneth that alle been dampned to the fier of helle at the jugement that han noon warantG of the Passioun of Jhesu Crist.

div.head: Chapter 21
div.ab: [1] AndT I saugh hevene newe and erthe newe. The firste hevene and the firste erthe wenten awey, and the se is no more seen. [2] And I saugh the cité of Newe Jerusalem comyng doun fro hevene tiffidG of God as the spouse ournedG T of hir lord. [3] And I herde a grete vois out of the trone that seide, “Loo, the tabernacle of God with men. And he schal woneG with hem and schal been hereG God, and thei schulen been his folk. And he God schal been with hem here God. [4] And he schal doun awey alle teeres fro her eiyen, and never after schal be deth, wepyng, ne cry ne sorewe. For thei ben alle passid.”
[5] And he that sat on the trone seide, “I have alle thing maad newe.” And seide to me, “Writ thou, for these been most trewe wordis and verrey.”G T

[6] And he seide to me, “It is doon.T I am bigynnynge and endynge and schal gyven hem that been athirstT of the wele of water of lyf and of grace.N [7] He that overcometh schal weldenG these, and I schal been his God, and he schule be my sone. [8] But to the dredefuleG and to the mysbelevynge and to the lieres and to the omycydisG and to lecchoures and to hem that loven huntyngN and alle that honouren maumetrieG and to venym doeresG T and thei that ben cursede, her part schal been in the pondT of fier brennynge with brunstoon that isT the [fol. 233r] secounde deth.”

The newyngeG of hevene and and erthe bitokeneth the grete joye that the aungelis schulen maken and the hooli halowen in the resureccioun and in the glorifiying of her bodies. That the see is no more seen bitokeneth that the bodies schulen no more felenG tribulaciouns of the world. The holi citee Jerusalem bitokeneth holi chirch, the comyng doun fro hevene that he understonde that alle the goodis that he hath comen fro God above. The tiffyng bitokeneth the licnesseG that sche schal have with hir spouse Jhesu in glorifiynge of fleisch. The vois of the trone that Seynt Joon herde bitokeneth the good understondynge that God gyveth to the goode prelatis of his privetees. The tabernacle of God bitokeneth the flesch of Jhesu Crist, in which he schal be with hise, not oonli in his manhede but in his godhede, and that is that he seith he schal been with hem her God. That he seithT he schal do aweyT alle teres fro her eiyen bitokeneth that he schal yelden riche mede for the tribulaciouns that thei han suffrid for hym. That he seith that deeth schal no more been bitokeneth the sekirnesseG that thei han and schulen han for alle way,G and been passid synnes and peynes.G That is to seie, thei schulen never han wepynge of contricioun ne crie of schrifte ne sorewe ne travaile to amenden hem. That he seith, “Writ,” bitokeneth that oure Lord monestithG us thorough his messageris and thorough hooli writ to the verrey goodisT that been above, that we do that that we owenG to do to hym. The water of lyf that he bihotithG to hem that ben buxumG to his comaundementis and desiren her helthe that he seith and thorough grace bitokeneth that thorough his grace we been savede, and makith us to stonde ageyn synne and agenne the fende and overcomenT and delyveren us fro deth to lyf, and schal glorifien us in bodi and in soule and schal maken us to seen sothliG that we now belevene. But now oneliT we schulen seen it, but we schulen han it of his grace, God and man in the blisse of his Fadir. And that is that he seith, he schal weldenG alle his thing. And as he is Goddis sone thorough kynde,G he hath maad us to been Godis sones thorough goode desire and thorough grace in blisse. And that is that he seith, “I schal been to hem God, and thei schulen benn my sones.”T Bi the dreedfulG ben bitokened hem that han so areweG hertisT that thei dorenG no goode leren.G Bi the mysbilevynge ben bitokened thei that wolen not [fol. 233v] resceyve the right bilevene. That thei ben acursid been bitokned hem that thorough here trespas and her synnes been dampned fro God and holi chirche and wolen not amenden hem. Bi the homycides been bitokenede hem that sleen her neighebores bothe bodyly and goostly. The lecchoures been bitokned alle that han to doon with woman out of wedlakT or in other synnen thorough delit of fleisch.T Bi the hunteris been bitokened hem that corumpen other thorough evel ensaumple and thorough false techyne and evel counseile ageen Goddis wille. The ydolateris bitoknen hem that honouren false goddis or more loven worldly thingis than God. The lieresT bitoknen alle that knowlechenG Jhesu Crist with mouthis and doon not his werkis, and alle that thorough falsnesse disceyven her neighebores ageyn right. Bi the pond of fier brennynge with brunstoun bitokeneth the putG of helle brennynge and stynkynge, there alle wrecchis schulen be dampned and tormentid withouten ende in bodi and in soule. And that is the secounde deth,T for ther is noon raunsoum. For the rightful juge Jhesu Crist may not flecchen,G ne the jugement been withclepidG for gifte ne preier.

[9] And there cam oon of the seven aungelis that hadden the sevene violis of the sevene laste woundis, and spak to me and seide, “Cum with me, and I schale schewen to thee the spose of the Lomb.” [10] And he lad me in goost up to a gret hile and high and schewed me the holy citee of Jerusalem cominge doun fro hevene [11] and hade the brightnesse of GodT and ferdeG T as pressyous stoon, as the stoon of jasper and of cristalle, [12] and hade a grete walle and heighe and hade twelveT gatis and in the gatis twelve margaritis,G N and the names of the twelve kyndisG of the sones of IraelG T been writen thereon. [13] To the estwarde thre gatis and to the westward thre gatis and to the northhalfG T thre gatis. [14] And to the cité hadde twelve foundementisG and in hem the twelve names of the apostlis and of the Lomb.

[15] And he that spak to me hadde a yerdeG of a redeG of gold to metenG with the cité and the gatis and the wal. [16] And the citee was squar and the lengthe of it as myche as the brede.G And he matG the citee with a rede overgiltG twelve thousand paasG N aboute, and the lengthe and the brede and the height been right so.G [17] And he mat the wallis an hundrid and foure and fourti cubitisG bi mesure of man and aungil.

That the aungil ladde Seynt Joon to a greet hil and high to seen the spouse of the Lomb bitokeneth hem [fol. 234r] that thorough the grace of God ben led into highG lyf for to have knowyng of the blisse that hooli chirche abidith after. The light that semede as preciouse stoon jasper and cristal bitokeneth that the vertuG N of holi chirche is confermedG in the vertu of the bileve and in brightnesse of the clennesse of baptem and in brightnesse of werkisT of schrift. The grete walles and highe bitokneth Jhesu Crist that kepith alle. The twelve gatis bitokneth the twelve apostlis. The twelve names writen bitokneth the twelve fadris of the old lawe, the patriarkis and tho profetis that profeciedennG er the apostlis camen to prechen. The thre gatis to the estward bitokeneth the bileve of the Trinité that was prechid to the Jewis, that Jhesu Crist tok fleisch and blod of mayden Marie, and in at tho thre gatis may a man comen whane he is cristned. In nomine Patris and Filii and Spiritus Sancti,G Amen. The thre gatis to the northward bitokeneth the prechyng that was prechid to the Saracenes.G At the thre gatis may a pore mann comen thorough hungir, thirst, and cold if he be paciente therin. The thre gatis to the southward bitokeneth the predicaciounG T that was prechid after the Incarnacioun, and there may a riche man comen in thorough these thre thingis: thorough fastynge and bedis bedyngG and almesse dedis.G The thre gatis to the westward bitokeneth the prechynge that schal be prechid to hem that lyven in the last ende of the world that Elye and Ennok shulen turnen to the right bileve, and at tho gatis may a man entren thorough other thre thingis, that is sothfast schrift, penaunce, andT sorewe of herte. The twelve foundementis that weren in the wal and the twelve names of the apostlis and of the Lomb bitokneth the twelve patriarkisT that helden the lawe of Jhesu Crist that in her tyme was to come, and the twelve apostlis helden it after his comynge that we holden now. The reed of gold bitokeneth holi writ, in which the wisdam of God is bitokned bi the gold. The mesure of the citee bitokneth that oure Lord gyveth the feith in holi chirche up that ech man may beren, and ordeyneth diverse degrees in holi chirche in which a man may saven hym,G as in maydenhedG and widewehedeG and right weddyng, that noon may be saved but if he be founden in on of these thre. The four half of the citee bitokeneth the right bileveT and sothfast charité and blessidhed.G For the more that a man leeveth,G the more he hopith. The more he hopith, the more he loveth and the moreT he doith in werk. And that is in length and heighte of citee.T Bi the length is bitoke|ned [fol. 234v] lastyngeG in these foure. That the aungele matG the wal an cxliiiiG cubitis bitokeneth perfeccioun of goode werkis after the Ten Comaundementis and the Gospelis thorough which man cometh to perfeccioun of aungil. And that is that he seith, “The mesure of man and aungil.”

[18] And the wal is of jasper and the citee of gold pure and clere as glas. [19] The foundement of the cité is ournedG of alle manere preciouse stone. The first foundement is jasper. The second is safeer,G the thride calcedoyne,G the ferthe emeraud,G [20] the fifte sardonycle,G the sixte sardoyne,G the seventhe crisolit,G the eightethe beril,G the ninthe topasie,G the tenthe crysopas,G the eleventhe jacinte,G the twelvethe the amatist.G

That the wal is jasper and the citee gold bitokneth that thei that schulen governenT othere in hooli chirche owen to been of fastereG bileeve and of heighereG lyf, as a preciouse ston is richere than gold. That the foundement of the cité of God was ourned with alle manere prescious stoon bitokeneth that the patriarkis weren and the profetisT ful of alle manere vertue. The jasper that is cleneG bitokeneth stedfast bileeve as Abraham hadde.N Saphire that hath coloure as the eirG bitokneth hem that been in highe hope, as Seynt Poule that seyde, “Oure conversaciounG is in heven.”N Calcedoyne that hath the colour paleG bitokeneth hem that lyvene scharpG lyve. Emeraud that is grene and clene bitokeneth hem that ben in verrey feith.T SardonycleT that is of thre coloures,N blak bynethe and clere amyddisG and above grene, bitokeneth hem that been meke and myld and of clene conscience and of greet bryghtnesse. Crisolit that hath the colour of gold sparclynge bitokeneth the wise that been wise in Goddis wisdam and therwith techenT to the othere and monesten hem to goode. Beril that clemethG as water thereG the sunne smytG bitokneth hem that wel worchen and monesten othere thorough goode ensaumple to do wele. Topasy that hath the colour of the cleerT eire that wexith derk thorough coldN bitokeneth the wise religiounG T that setten here hertis to the goodis above and gyven nothing of here herte to the world. Crisopas that is grene medlydG and the colour of gold and cometh forth in YndeG bitokeneth hem that been in good bileeve and charité and folowen the tracisG of Jhesu Crist that came out of the est.G Jacyncte that chaungith with the eir and is bright in brightnesse and in derk wedirG derk bitokeneth wise men in holi chirche that kunnenG confermenG T diverse men to the right bileeve. [fol. 235r] Amatist that is a purpure that hath the colour mengidG T as the violet and of rose and castith flawmG fro hym bitokeneth hem that han mynde of the heighe kyngdom of hevene and desiren the felawschip of aungelis and of martires and confessoures,G that is purpre medlid with violet and with rose, and putten her charité to her enemyes and biddenG for hem.N
[21] And the twelveT gatis been twelve margaritis,G N ech gate a margarite. And the stretes of the citee been of gold as clere as glas glistrynge.G

[22] And I saugh no temple in the citee, for the Lord almyghtful is his temple, and the Lomb. [23] And the citee hath no mysterG of sunne ne of mone, for the brightnesse of God hath lighted it and the Lombe is his lanterne. [24] And the folkis of erthe schulen goon in his light, and the kyngis of erthe schulen beren to hym her glorie and honour.T [25] And the gatis schulen not be schute bi daye, and nyght schal not be there.T [26] And thei schulen bryng glorie and honour of hethene menN into hir.T [27] Ne foule thing schal come therein, ne abhomynacioun ne lesyngG ne noon but here names been written in the book of lyf and of the Lomb.

That in the gatis been twelve margaritis bitokeneth hem that shulen wissenG othere to techen hem the right bileve owenG to been cleen of vertu and bright.G The stretis of the citéT ben bitokened the sympleG in holi chirche that ben abrod in the world and han here wyves and the richesse. Thei owen to been bryght as gold thorough the werkis of charitee, and that thei doon do it in clene conscience, and so thei schulen been cleer as the glas thorough innocente of baptem or thorough sothfast shrift and right bileve. That he saugh no temple in the cité bitokeneth that holi chirche schal han no mystG to preiere ne to sacrifice whan that schal been alle glorified. Ne it schal han no mist of sonne ne of mone, that is to seie whanne it is glorified it schal han no myste of prechynge ne of techere ne of kepere.G That the kingis and the folk schulen goon in his light bitokneth that agennG the endynge of this world the religious of God schulen wexeG moreT and men schulen forsaken worldli blisse for hope of blisse above that evere schal last. That the gatis schulen not be schitG bi dayT bitokeneth that tribulaciouns ne sorewes schulen not disturblenG man to serve God as it doith now here in this lyf. That no foul thing schal entre ne noon but his name be writen in the book of lyf and the Lomb [fol. 235v] bitokneth that noon schal entre but if he be clene thorough the blod of Jhesu Crist and thorough the sacrament of hooli chirche and bot if that he confermeG T his lyf to Jhesu Cristis lyf in erthe here that was write for us on the cros.

div.note: been passid synnes and peynes, sins and pains have passed away
In nomine Patris and Filii and Spiritus Sancti, (Latin) In the name of the Father and Son and Holy Spirit

div.head: Chapter 22
div.ab: [1] And he schewide to me a ryver of water of lyf cleer as cristalle and came fro the sege of God and the Lomb [2] and amyddis the strete of the citee. And on bothe halfG the ryver was the tre of lyf that berith twelve fruitis, and ech monethG he castithG his fruyt. And the leves of the tree been heelthG to men. [3] And ech cursid thing schal no more be.T And the seege of God and of the Lomb schal been in the tree, and his servauntis schulen serven hym.T [4] And thei schulen seen his face, and his name schal been in her forhede. [5] And nyght schal been no more. And thei schulen han no mesterG of lyght ne of sonne, for the Lord God schal lighten hem. And thei schulen regne with hym withouten ende.

The rever of the water of lyf is bitokened the joye that never schal faylen. Bi the sege is bitokned the hieghst halowenG thorough which othere comen to grace and to blisse, and that is the ryver that cometh fro the sege of God and of the Lomb. Bi the water of lyf that is clere as cristalle is bitokenede blisse, for thorough the water of baptem man wanG it. The o partG of the ryver bitokneth the folk erG the baptem cam. And after also, on both half the ryver was the tre of lyf. For both on the too partG and on that othere, sumeG been saved thorough bileve of the crosN that is prechid to hem thorough the twelveT apostlis. That he yeldith ech moneth his fruyt bitokneth that thorough the patriarkis and apostlisT weren in ech tyme summe brought to the bileeve. The leves of the tree bitokneth the comaundementis of Jhesu in his Gospel that been goode to helpe of men if thei been kept. That nevere schal be no cursid thingT bitokned that there schal nevere more be synne ne peyne for synnes. That Godis sete and the Lambis schal been in the tree bitokneth that alle we been savede thorough Jhesu Cristis Passioun that he suffrede on the cros and his glorie and his blis of hevene gyven to us. And we been his servauntis, and there we schulen servenne hym with his aungelis withouten ende. That he seith thei schulen seen his face and his name schal be writen in here forhedis bitokneth that is writen in the Gospele, “That is lyf withouten ende, that thei schulen knowen hym oneli God sothfast and Jhesu Crist whom he sent.”N In anothere stedG in the Gospel seith Jhesu [fol. 236r] Crist, “He that avowethG hym to me bifore men, I schal avowen hym biforn my Fader in hevene.”N And that is that he seith his name schal be writen in her forhedis. That he seith he schal han no myster of light ne of lanterne ne of sune is expounedG bifore.N

[6] And the aungele seid to me, “These wordes been trewe and sothfast, and the Lord God of spiritis sente his aungele to the profetis and schewide to his servauntis thingis that sone moteG be doon. [7] Loo, I come hasteli. Blessid ben thei that keppen the profecye of this book.”

[8] And I, Joon, after that I hadde herde and seen, fel a knees biforn the aungelis fet to honouren hym that had schewid this and told. [9] And he seide, “Lok thou do it not! For I am Goddis servaunt and thin and thi britheren profetis,G and hem that kepen the profecie of this book. Gife worschippe to God.” It is expouned biforn.T

[10] And the aungil seide to me, “Hide not these wordis of the profecie, for the tyme is nygh. [11] He that noiez,G noghe yit,G and he that is in filth, wax fulG yit, and he that is just, be justiedG yit, and he that is holi, be halewidG yit.T

[12] “Lo, I come soone and my yeldyngeG with me, to yeldG to eche after his werkis. [13] I am the first and the last, bigynnynge and endynge. [14] And thei been blessid that waschen here stolisG in blod of the Lomb, that her myght be in the tre of lyf, and that comen in by the gatis into the citee. [15] But hundisG schulen ben withoute, and thei that poysounnenT othere and the foule and the homycidesT and thei that serven to maumetrieG and ech that loveth and makith lesyngis.G”

That the aungele defendedeG Joon to hiden thisG T bitokeneth that man schal not lettenG to seyn the sothe for enpeyryngG of the wickid. For if the goodeG been hurt in bodi forG the wickid been sterid,G it tourneth hem to goostliT profit, for thei weschen heer stolis in blod of the Lomb. Thei that doon penance in the myght of Jhesu Crist, heer myghtes been in the tree of lyf. That setten not here trustT in her penaunce ne in her werkis but oneli in the Passioun of Jhesu Crist, thei schulen entre into the citee bi the gatis, that thorough techinge of the apostlis and thorough the sacrament of hooli chirche passen out of this world thorough the right bileve. But hundis schulen not comen therin, that been mysbilevynge men and wymmen that scryven hemG and resseyven God and han no wil to leven her synnes. Thei doon as the hond doith, castithG that he hath etyn, and whan he is hungry, [fol. 236v] goth ageyn therto. So doon thei that schryven hem and goon ageen to here synne, for thei been not sory for here synnes.N And thei that poysunnen othere thorough wickid deede or speche or ensaumple, that foloweth the expowned biforn. Of lesyngisG and homecides and hem that been leefG to heren lesyngis,T he makith lesyngis with word and with deede that his wil is to here hem.
[16] “And I, Jhesu, have sent myn aungil to witnesse these thingis to you that been in hooli chirche. I am roteG and kyndG of Davyth,N clerre stereG in the morowenyngG schynynge.”
[17] And the Spirit and the spouseT seith, “Kum.”T And he that thursteth come, he that wil resceyven the water of lyf of pure grace.

That Jhesu sent his aungil to witnessen these thingis bitokeneth that oure Lord sent hooli writ to beren witnesse to undoG the folkT the privetees of God. That he seith he is rote bitokneth that he susteyneth and kepith alle thing as to his godhed, and he is kynd of Davyth as to the fleisch. And the stere that lightith the world thorough his techynge and the morewe stere,G for thorough the Resureccioun that was doon in the morowenynge, he brought tithyngG of oure brightnesse, for he gaf good ensaumple to alle the world. That the spirit and the spouse seith, “Cum thu to me,”T bitokeneth that the Trinité in holi chirche monestith us to understondenT holi writ and to doon it in werk. And thei that undirstonden it amonesten othere. That he seith, “He that hath thrist, come,” bitokneth that thei that desiren sothfast blisse in hevene, thei owen to doon it in deede and affienG hem not in eny thing that thei wel doon, but ooneli in grace. And that is that he seith, “Reseve ye water of lyf.”T

[18] I aferme the profecye of this book to alle that heren it. If eny do moreG therto, God schal doon upon hym the woundisG of this book writun. [19] If eny lasseG T the wordis of this book and of this profecye, God schal bynymenG hym the book of lyfT and of the holy citee and fro hem that been writen in this book.
[20] He seith that berith witnese of these thingis, “Amen. I come sone.” Amen. Kum, Lord Jhesu.
[21] The grace of oure Lord be with youT alle. Amen.

Heerin been acursid the wickid stynckyngG that agenseienG the profecyeT of this book writen and the eretikis mysbilevynge that corumpen thorough false understondynge, and the false discretifrisG that tournen hooli writ that is gostli to pletenG withT [fol. 237r] worldli thingis, and the false profetis that prechen to been preised of the world or to wynnen erthli goodis.N That he seith, “I come sone,” and seith not whane bitokneth that he seith in the Gospel, “That day ne that houre no man wot, ne aungil of hevene, but oneli the Fader,”N whan the day of jugement schal comen. And therfore he seith, seG thorough right bileve and makithT thorough goode werkis and biddithG to God thorough devocioun. For ye witten nevere whan he schal come. And therfor it is nede to been alle wey redyT and to lyven so right as man schulden right now go the jugement. That he seith, “Kum, Lord Jhesu,” bitokneth the grete desire that holi chirche hath to be glorified thorough the comyng of Jhesu Crist at the jugement. That he seith, “The grace of oure Lord be with us alle,” bitokneth the lyf of grace that oure Lord hath gove to holi chirche thorough the deth of Jhesu Crist and of his Resureccioun til that thei come to the lyf of blisse. Jhesu Crist, Goddis Sone and MariesT also, that is o God almyghtful with the Fadere and the Holi Goost, lighte oure herte with stedfast bileve and bynd it with trustG hopeT and send us his grace of love and charité, and send us grace to bilevene and dienT in hym, that we may come with hym into blisse in bodi and soule and dwele with hym withouten ende. Amen.T
